values: First LJ entry in a while. I feel like I should make some incredibly worthy and interesting statement. BUTTSECKSSSSS. So yeah, one of my ex's friends is romantically/sexually (I didn't ask) involved with his cousin. Everyone is making him feel bad about this. I've met his cousin, and I have to say, if he was my cousin I'd shag him in an instant. Fuck, if he was my *dad* I'd shag him in an instant. So yeah, what do I do? My heart tells me I should tell him how I feel about his situation, but my head is telling me that if everyone else is telling him to not do it it'd probably be easier for all concerned if I went with the flow. At least if everyone's telling him to stop there's no conflict there, but their reasons for it are things like "it's just wrong" (nothing is just wrong), or "there's no future in it" (so fucking what?! there's no future in about 99% of orgasms, doesn't mean they're not worth having).
Last night Chris and I went to the Picturedrome and watched a jazz band and I put my head on his shoulder and he didn't seem to mind.  He obviously wants my babies.  Oh yes.

Jesus is back on-line, back in halls, and kicking an ass.

I won't bore you too much with the details, but in summary: I left uni, I got bored, I did some work over summer, and now I've restarted my course in Northampton.  Dom, I was going to tell you this, but actually no, I wasn't going to.  There was some reason that I can't really remember now.

So now I'm here.  Fresher's week has passed, just like last time.  The obligatory lay is out of the way, and I'm all set to fall madly and pathetically in love with the next completely-heterosexual-but-very-tolerant-considering guy I meet.  

Who am I kidding, his name's Chris.  He has a ukulele and when I played "Ultravisitor" to him his face lit up like he was receiving a thousand blowjobs.  These are the things that make life worth living.

Lectures start tomorrow, they'll probably be wizard or something.  I'm never going to use the word "sick" to mean "good", or in the case of most people I've heard use it, to describe Hard-Fi.

And so another anticlimax rolls into town. I'm entering the vinegar strokes of full-time education, and it increasingly seems that it's meant nothing. It doesn't feel like the end of something, or the beginning of something else. It's just flat and bland and nothing. There's some party in another block that no-one seems to have any enthusiasm for, I sort of want to go but know that if I do I'll just end up getting drunk and morose. I don't really know what else to do, and I really don't want to end up staying up on-line all night again. 

God.

Here's a follow-up to the other night's carcrash. "Firstly, I spent a while nuzzling up to Owen in Studio1. Owen took it with good humour, which in my drunken state I took for him wanting my hot ass. I haven't seen him since, but I'm actually quite looking forward to the awkward moment." The awkward moment was just as good as I predicted, and I've now totally fallen for him in the worst kind of way. I now think I can win him over by doing nice things for him. Thank fuck I'm only here another week. I'm currently looking after a plate he stole from the canteen. He was supposed to pick it up from my room last night and didn't and for a while I was very very depressed. I suck, he rulz. "The bad part is when I got back, having split a cab with some guy we met in Tesco's. I invited him in, we talked about music and drank wine and ate kebab sandwiches together and so on. And then I tried to come onto him. It didn't work very well. He was very polite about it and let me kiss him but never reciprocated. I didn't want him to leave and really persisted with it. I was, in short, a complete asshole. He gave me his number, bizarrely." Even more bizarrely, the number was actually his! Haven't seen him again yet but he seems far too amicable about it. I guess he's flattered or some stupid thing. Owen wins on the day because he didn't tell me he wished I was a girl. Wishing I was a girl is so over. If I was a girl no-one would let me in their house. I'd have distinct marks on my back from being done against skips.
I finally have a track to put on-line and no idea how to do it.  Any ideas?

I've been using MySpace for a while and it's becoming horribly addictive. I think the site may have labotomised me in my sleep. Today, I have been wondering what the next default hilarious thing will be on the wtfscene. First pirates, then ninjas... I say either mummies/pharoahs, zombies, or Vikings. Do my shitty quiz pissniggaz link

Why are so many gay people mentally retarded?  Can we not have some kind of accuity test before allowing someone to entertain homosexual thoughts?  "You must be at least this sane to ride cock", sort of thing?  Man, I despair.

http://images.google.co.uk/images?q=kitten%20fluffy&hl=en&lr=&sa=N&tab=wi

Funnier than anything you could come up with.

Damn those aborted nights out: last night instead of going out for the first time in bloody ages I ended up staying in yet again, still in my cowboy costume, having a big drunken fingerbang wank.  It's a unique experience, but not one I can really recommend.  I'm keeping the hat, if nothing else.
I've just had a 2 hour lecture and 20 minute conversation with an audio guy from Electronic Arts (EA), and I didn't once mention James Pond.  But i was thinking it pretty hard.

Today was another medium one.  Band practise did the usual thing of beginning to get good for about the last 20 minutes before everyone had to leave.  But we got something down, something that I at least am happier with, something which isn't four chords looping in a continuous psychedelic funk jam.  It's nice when that doesn't happen.

Spoke to Howard about careers today, he did the decent thing and passed the buck, but not before we'd had an awkward conversation.  I did my best to avoid seeming emotional and crap like I always do.  So far he's the only one who's bothered to try and defend the uni course; everyone else has taken more of a "what else are you going to do?" angle on it.  Whatever.  My mind has never been more made up about anything.  If it turns out I'm wrong, I'll live with it.

A toy!
SSloppy
TTemperamental
EEdgy
VVain
EExhausting

Name / Username:

Name Acronym Generator
From Go-Quiz.com
If I'm trying to moderate my drinking, is there any point in going out at all?

Just had a careers advice session.  Two other people showed up.  Possibly they have a better grasp of reality that I do, but it's likely that they're just lazier/employed.  Anyway, it was naive to hope that it could help, all it really did was hilight the depressing reality of my chosen career.  I felt sorry for the woman giving the talk, she was doing her best, but it takes time and preparation to sugarcoat something like that, especially when you find you're giving your talk to three very attentive people instead of fifty who just want to talk about Neighbours for a bit.

In all of the interweb, I can't find a shred of pictorial evidence that Postman Patel - a short-lived and slightly iffy Beano strip about an Asian postman - ever existed.  I'd forgotten about it til Dom reminded me, and "thank fuck" doesn't begin to encompass the emotions I will feel if it turns out to have all been a hideous dream, but please, for my peace of mind, confirm or deny please.

oh, and lol:

From an entry in January:

"OOOOOOH, except I went to Hush shortly before i left Northampton, and it's actually good. Didn't take much time to admire the metalwork, but all signs point to my b-in-law havng done a good job. Better than your average gaytarded druggerist, anyway. Anyway, it have glass bricks and the walls didn't sweat and EVERYTHING. I'd go there again. In fact, I'd flunk my degree just to spend more time there. but then, I'm a spastic, so, you know."

Sunrise, sunset.

It's like looking into my future  

http://www.bumwine.com/

I think I will become a socialite.  Or a philanthropist.  Or a rent.

Anyone wanna suggest some jobs that I could do?  I have HND level qualifications and I'm reasonably limber.

My god, I can't wait til I get my laptop fixed so I can get on-line in my room like the old days.  OK, so it was turning me into a crotchetty social retard, but at least I didn't have to use the IT room.  I can't tell if the people here are genuine morons or if its just the accent.  I think it might be both.  How smart does a marine biology student have to be?

I feel quite rough.  I'm still recovering from Sunday night, which was a tad embarassing.  I need to find more people my own age, going out to get plastered really has lost its appeal.  I went to the student bar on Sunday with the intention of just having a nice quiet drink and a chat.  I end up wandering down to Bacchus and back at 1am in my slippers and using someone else's toilet.  I've got some funny looks.  I can't remember if I wrote all this up yesterday, but never mind.

Point is, I'm sick of going out and getting plastered.  Maybe if I was more of a dancer... it's sad, but I drink excessively because there's nothing else to do out.  People up here are wankers and I'd rather just be hanging out with people who I actually WANT to get to know.  I do the suck so bad.  I was under the impression that people in their twenties eventually start going to nice quiet places likes that bar in Coupling and drink sensibly and have conversations below pain threshold and so on.  Like Coupling.  Or some other nice TV show for nice people.  Like The Good Life only younger.

I was going to give up drinking, but re-reading some of this I think I should drink more.

Richard broke up with me.  We're staying friends, which basically means doing what we've been doing for the last couple of weeks.  I don't know how to feel about it, hopefully I will at least figure out what it is that I'm going to go through soon.  Tonight I didn't feel much, because part of me saw it coming.  I knew we were going through a quiet patch, but it was just a question of whether we make it through or not.

The real test will be whether Richard hooks up with someone else in about a week.  I doubt he will.  I had to put up with being molested all evening by people desperate for a bit of rebound action.  I don't get the concept really.

Will maybe write more later, too tired tonight, just walked home through rather a lot of snow/hail/some other cold thing.

My first band practise with my new Performance band has gone the same way as the last one with the old one.  i.e. the guy who means that we're rehearsing miles away from where I (and in this case we) live isn't picking up his phone, and I'm not trekking all the way down there with amp and FX pedal and guitar to find out it's been cancelled again.

I've wasted yet another day drinking without getting drunk, failing to write songs and watching dodgy DVDs.  The music director from The Making Of Silent Hill 2 is the gayest looking Japanese guy I've ever seen.

So yeah, the songwriting thing.  I think I'm going to be forced to accept that I'm not actually as good as I thought.  I've tried it from every angle, I've written from the heart and vomitted from the soul.  All this time, I've had in the back of my mind that, if  can't come up with anything wonderful, I'll just knock out some generic shit and they'll probably love it.

Well, I think I may have been bullshitting myself a bit.  Because I really can't do anything.  I am gloriously inept.  I write abstract because I can barely form a sentence, I write pretentious because I don't have anything to be honest about.  I'm a fucking waste.  So that's it.  I'm at a loss.  I'm just gonna have to give up.  I ahve a shitload of other essays and things to do, I really should be doing them.  I've wasted an entire bottle of wine on songwriting today, I'm going to have to get another one now.

Oh, if anyone has Neon Genesis: Evangelion or has seen it, I require information.  I'm getting obsessed with something I've never really even seen, and that can't be good.

God I hate Burray and Stormbeard.  I wish they would just fucking die.


















:D
The other day, speaking to D0m on MSN, he seemed to have matured a bit and made peace with the world.  But it was only temporary.  Maybe he was drunk.  Who gives a flying fuck?

Predictably, having moved rooms, my laptop has stopped doing teh interweb again.  But it was worth it.  I'm about 20 yards away from where I was, and already I'm enjoying it.  The E Block people were very much Small Doses types, and they don't seem too bothered by what I did to the kettle shortly before I left.  

Today's going pretty well (although that's what I said the day my laptop died), I think I'm getting a handle on CSound, although it's still very very frightening.  Came up with a short song, will either elaborate on the lyrics or just leave them as they are and wank around at the end.  Probably both.  I'll kill it, I know I will.  But yeah, it's about Sarah and home, and it made me feel all warm and happy.  The one about Alice is still shit though.

That's all so far.  I'm going to the theatre later with Richard, so I should probably start drinking in a couple of hours.  God knows what's going to happen, but meh.  It gets me out of the LGB meeting tonite, and that's what's important.

So yeah.

Got some results today, they're pretty shit but not as shit as they could've been.  Got them straight after a band practise so I don't really trust my reactions much.  I've done ok on essay writing, just shit on the creative side, which is kind of what I expected.

The band practise was as it always is.

Anyway, I'm seeing a guy called Richard now.  that's pretty much everything.

This is just a quick update to say that my laptop killed itself (kinda) and that's why I haven't been updating my LJ or anything.  I should be back on-line soon, but pretty much my entire iTunes was lost :(  That is all.

Someone on the network loves my iTunes selection so much they actually felt motivated to tell their friend, so I found out through them.  it's been suggested that this might get me laid.  But the notion of getting sex by having a massive bulging record collection was banished from my mind many years ago, when I realised that it was flagrant balls.

What the hell is the difference between Death Cab For Cutie and The Postal Service?

I'm just back from the pub crawl which means - no shit - I'm back at uni as well!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! omfg indeed.  The thing with Scott (which I so eloquently circumlocquaiced last entry) has kind of fizzled out, I managed to make him feel just a tiny weeny bit guilty for assuming I only wanted to stay in touch for the sake of blowjobs: Scott, that's what you get for dragging me out to "The Rocks" at god knows what freezing hour.  Just kidding, I still love him really and fellate him in my dreams.  

Little else to tell really.  The course now requires me to study paintings and computer programming, while actual music is still far from compulsory.  I guess it comes from teaching Cage; technically, you reading this is music.  I'd leave if I thought I could escape the bullshit that surrounds me, but it follows like a lost child.  

DOM.  DO YOU GET IT YET?  IT TEACHES YOU ABOUT MUSIC.  NOT ABOUT TRIVIA.  MUSIC.  FOR LIKE, YOU KNOW, USAGE.  AS OPPOSE TO CUNTS.

Not that I am slacking in my cuneform duties.  Sorry to those who avidly follow my journal (Apparently you exist.  Make yourselves the fuck known.) for not updating it while I was on holiday.  If it matters to you, fuck all happened.  OOOOOOH, except I went to Hush shortly before i left Northampton, and it's actually good.  Didn't take much time to admire the metalwork, but all signs point to my b-in-law havng done a good job.  Better than your average gaytarded druggerist, anyway.  Anyway, it have glass bricks and the walls didn't sweat and EVERYTHING.  I'd go there again.  In fact, I'd flunk my degree just to spend more time there.  but then, I'm a spastic, so, you know.

Can the birds outside my window please STFU?  I'm drunk, btfuckingw.

So tomorrow I'm leaving.  About 11.  Packing's more or less done, feeling a little weird just weighting around in a room that looks both messy and tidy at the same time.  I'll sort it tomorrow.

It's been an eventful few days, and I'm afraid that, for now at least, I don't want to divulge it, even to the anonymous hordes that read my LJ.  Maybe some time in the future, but not for now.  You'll understand if and when that happens.  Until then, this is me signing off til January. 

Probably.

It's an on-line all-nighter!

Got banned from the Kerrang forum, but it was my own fault really.  I've had really not a great deal to drink, so I'm probably just going to drink some water and get past it.  Actually, I might get some sleep, it's nearly 7 and I'd like to find out for definite whether I can sleep in daylight.  Plus I could do with a wank.  It's been a while since I've needed one, and I don't want to jinx it.

As of 7pm last night, I have finished uni for Christmas.  All I have to do now is wait around in my room to go home.  Which obviously will be a major adjustment from what I've been doing for the last three months or so.  I don't really know what to make of the last few months, so I'll leave taking stock til later.  All I can really say is that living away from home is surprisingly similar to not doing it.  Odd, really.

Oh well, it does at least mean I can spend a bit more time actually trying to make music, and eventually tidy up the place, maybe do some washing this weekend.  Go to uni for the experience, they said.

It seems even Blair has got bored of making the same old identikit metal and cancelling rehearsals.  The only reason this could be abd is that we're meant to be assessed on it in about an hour.  Fuck it.

Dom showed me this.  Beautiful, just beautiful:

http://www.rubbishgays.blogspot.com/

I've stayed in and done work and interwebbed about and generally done little of interest for the last few days.  So, in honour of that, here are some links that I feel will illustrate some of my recent travels and enjoyments:

http://foxweb.marist.edu/users/emily.dovi/album5/album5

http://www.warprecords.com/

http://www.thewire.co.uk/web/air.php

http://www.thewire.co.uk/web/mp3.php

http://ubb.kerrang.com/postlist.php?Cat=&Board=rantsandraves

http://www.fetishman.co.uk/

http://discoveryhealth.queendom.com/questions/eiq_abridged_1.html

Do the test above if you can be bothered.  I got 88.  I'm not entirely surprised, but I suspect anyone who scores highly on it would be a bubbly twat who I would hate, so bleh.
I just had an unnervingly enjoyable wank over that Bam Margera sex tape.  I feel all wrong inside.

This weekend, two band practises have been cancelled, and the person who was supposed to be getting a digital camera for me has rescheduled and then not bothered.  I could've been doing my essay, but I'm shit at teh writing.  So basically, the last four days of my life have been completely pointless and shouldn't have happened.  

I want to be in a band called The Far East and do some finger painting.
and since making that report, everything has been sorted out.

this isn't even the first time it's happened.  For some reason, people  who meet me convince themselves that there's something deep and meaningful going on beneath the surface, that I'm something wonderful underneath my surface.  I wish I knew why they think this.  I'm sure that not everyone is subject to this much scrutiny.  Am I really so fascinating?  It's not a gradual thing either, they do it within seconds of meeting me.  I wish they didn't.  Because ultimately, I end up being the one who has to deal with their frustration when they find out that either a) there's no way to get to this "Real Me", or b) they were wrong, and this is all there is.

It's just more complication in my life that I don't need.  I don't know anyone else that seems to have this trouble.  You spend your whole teenage years feeling different, and then, just when you've gotten away from it, *everyone else* starts thinking the same thing.  I'm sick of all this "what is normal?" crap.  Can't the government or someone just set up a universal standard of what is normal, and then we can either be that or not be that.  It'd solve a lot of my problems, and in the end I think you'll agree, they're the only ones that matter.

It's been a long time, but lately I really fucking hate myself.  I don't know what's wrong with me.  Matt says I have "some growing up to do", but I don't see the point; I'd just be faking being over this stage of my life, moving onto another one, and having to deal with both at the same time.  Maybe he does understand, maybe there's some secret they tell you when you Grow Up.  I don't know.  All I know is, I don't see what difference it would make.

Christ, I'm just unravelling again.  I'm sick of being someone else again.  It's going to keep happening.  I don't know who I am anymore.  That's why I can't show my "true self", the nice guy or the asshole or whatever.  I started out being myself, my self being a miserable shit who hated himself and other people, and consequently was hated back or ignored.  Under these circumstances, it seemed not unreasonable to fake it, to be someone I'm not.  But now I'm older, everywhere I go people are valuing integrity and it's just so pathetic.  I don't know what other people are like, so I might be wrong here, but I'm guessing everyone you think is a genuine honest and open person is faking it at least half as much as me, because people who don't lie to themselves and others at every juncture tend to be incredibly unpopular.  People are really hard on liars, because they remind them of their own lies.  I think.  

Could be that everyone else in the world is exactly as they exhibit themselves to be, and it's just me that has the problem.  But if that's not true, I'm guessing everyone will just carry on in denial anyway.  So neither is actually better.

Fuck I suck.

I've pissed off Matt somehow.  I don't understand it.  I don't think I did anything particularly out of the ordinary, but he's pissed off at me.  When I spoke to him on MSN he said that he was pissed off because he thought I was a nice person, even though I act like an annoying twat.  I'm not unwilling to accept the possibility that I'm an annoying twat, but I don't understand the other bit.  I don't get why he's looking for a nice person in me when I don't apparently show any outward signs of being one.  I dont' even understand what he means by a nice person.

Basically, I don't understand.

I'll write more later, probably.
Maybe I'm wrong, maybe everyone, in every band, emerges from every band practise feeling like hours have been shaved off the end of their life.
